post: The National Civics Teacher of the Year Award was presented to Shari Conditt by representatives from the Bill of Rights Institute and SmartPass at a surprise school assembly on September 10. SmartPass, a leading provider of digital hall pass technology used by thousands of schools nationwide to increase student accountability and foster better outcomes, has joined the Bill of Rights Institute to help sponsor this years contest and awards. Peter Luba, CEO of SmartPass, discusses his company's sponsorship of BRI's National Civics Teacher of the Year Award. The 2024-2025 MyImpact Challenge is now open for submissions! MyImpact Challenge is a civic engagement contest that incentivizes students to become active in their communities. Recently, Rachel Humphries, BRI's Senior Director, Civic Learning Intitiaitves, spoke with Dave the Scholarship Coach, about the the contest. Listen to the podcast here  https://lnkd.in/eKG5g45j Scholarship GPS (  https://lnkd.in/eGYfPTWD), a sponsor of the 2024-2025 MyImpact Challenge, is dedicated to educating students and families on how to obtain a college degree without student loan debt. Scholarship GPS offers courses and coaching to guide students and parents through the process of finding the best scholarships and provides tips, tools, and strategies for creating winning applications.  #scholarshipopportunities  #billofrightsinstitute  #civicengagement

Constitution Day is today  and the Bill of Rights Institute featured a star-studded lineup for its annual Constitution Day Live! educational programming. This years theme is Built for This: Debate, Dialogue, & the Constitution.  BRI staff explored how our Constitutional system helps us navigate the disagreements that naturally emerge in a free society. With interviews with Condoleeza Rice, former U. S. Secretary of State and now the director of the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, Jane Kamensky, president and CEO of Monticello, Eric Meyer, editor and publisher of the Marion County Record, and author and scholar Yuval Levin, you wont want to miss it!  https://lnkd.in/ebkF728B  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #ConstitutionDayLive

Recently, retired Army Major Gerald Gangaram joined Larry Zilliox, host of Welcome Home: A Podcast for Veterans, About Veterans, By Veterans. In the episode, From Troubled Youth to Apache Pilot: Gerald Gangaram on Military Leadership, Mentorship, and Civic Education,  Gangaram discusses his distinguished career in the Army and his current mission with the Bill of Rights Institute. Gangaram's work with BRI underscores the importance of civic education and fostering better citizenship among future generations. Listen to this episode, here  https://lnkd.in/ebf7Kmwm.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI

As election season approaches, it can be an exciting opportunity for civic education, but it can also bring stress and anxiety, especially for students engaging in political discussions for the first time. The Bill of Rights Institute has partnered with Huddle Up, an expert in IEP therapy, SEL, and K-12 mental health services, to provide free downloadable resources, including regulation cards, breathing visuals, and break cards that educators can share with students navigating election stress. To access and download Huddle Up's free resources for managing election stress, visit  https://lnkd.in/e94EbExS  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #mentalhealth

Washington teacher Shari Conditt has been named Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! Thousands of Washington students have learned about Americas history, founding principles, and their rights and responsibilities as citizens in Shari Conditts classroom. Now, Conditt is being honored nationally for her exceptional work on behalf of Americas young people. The award, which was presented to Conditt by representatives from the Bill of Rights Institute and SmartPass at a surprise school assembly on September 10, comes with a $5,000 top prize. SmartPass, a leading provider of digital hall pass technology used by thousands of schools nationwide to increase student accountability and foster better outcomes, has joined the Bill of Rights Institute to help sponsor this years contest and awards. To read more, visit  https://lnkd.in/ewJHDkVq.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsTeacheroftheYear

It's a new day for school debate! The Bill of Rights Institute is proud to announce the acquisition of Incubate Debate, a rapidly expanding school debate organization. Together, we will dramatically expand the number of students who have access to debate. We will support teachers everywhere with high-quality classroom debate resources. And we will prioritize free speech and make sure diverse viewpoints are always welcome.
